newsitem.title: THAILAND: Alphatec down 14 pct in heavy trade.
newsitem.headline: Alphatec down 14 pct in heavy trade.

text.p: Shares of Thai computer giant Alphatec dropped sharply in heavy trade early on Thursday as investors unloaded the stock as it turned ex-dividend, analysts said.
Alphatec topped the active list and dropped 20 baht to a new year low of 123 by 0400 GMT. The shares had closed overnight at 143 and opened this morning at 137.

"They paid a 6.50 baht dividend so some people will just have been hanging on until they got that, but I also think investors are re-rating this stock to a lower base because the whole risk of the SubMicron venture has been shifted on to Alphatec," said an analyst at a Japanese broker.

Alphatec has pledged to help fund SubMicron Technology, which is building Thailand's first wafer fabrication plant, after bearish conditions in the Thai market prevented the firm raising funds through a domestic listing.

"The addition of SubMicron will impact ATEC sharply as SubMicron is forecast to lose 1.5 billion baht ($57.7 million) in 1997 and 1.8 billion baht in 1998," said Thaimex Finance and Securities in a recent report.
Alphatec's longer term prospects remain sound as SubMicrom is expected to return 1.5 billion in profit in 1999, but short term profits will be hit, analysts said.

"Initially I think the response to the consolidation was good but short term, probably the next two years, there is some risk and I think that is adding to selling pressures today," the analyst said. ($1 = 26 baht)
